intro: Psychotria paracatuensis, commonly known as the Amazonian psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within the dense rainforest understory. Psychotria paracatuensis is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses among indigenous communities.
